title: Instrument/Method: pi'o, ta'i
goal: Learn to specify tools and methods.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Location tags review:

bu'u = ?     fa'a = ?     to'o = ?

(Answers: at, toward, away from)

New Material (5-7 min)

New Vocabulary

Lojban Place Structure English
xamsi x1 is a sea/ocean of fluid x2 sea/ocean
kevna x1 is a cave/cavern in x2 cave/cavern

Instrument and Method Tags

Cmavo Meaning Use
pi'o using (tool) instrument
ta'i by method method/manner

Using pi'o (Using)

mi ciska pi'o lo penbi

I write using a pen.

mi citka pi'o lo forca

I eat using a fork.

mi viska pi'o lo kanla

I see using my eyes.

Using ta'i (By Method)

mi snada ta'i lo nu troci

I succeed by the method of trying.

mi cilre ta'i lo nu tcidu

I learn by the method of reading.

Combining Tags

mi ciska lo valsi pi'o lo penbi bu'u lo zdani

I write words using a pen at home.

Key Point

pi'o = using (tool/instrument), ta'i = by method (how you do it).
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Use pi'o

Translate:

  1. I write using a pen.
  2. Alice eats using a fork.
  3. I see using glasses.
Answers
  1. mi ciska pi'o lo penbi
  2. la .alis. cu citka pi'o lo forca
  3. mi viska pi'o lo lacni

Exercise 2: Use ta'i

Translate:

  1. I learn by reading.
  2. I succeed by trying.
  3. I understand by studying.
Answers
  1. mi cilre ta'i lo nu tcidu
  2. mi snada ta'i lo nu troci
  3. mi jimpe ta'i lo nu tadni

Exercise 3: New Vocabulary

Translate:

  1. This is a sea.
  2. I see a cave.
  3. The ocean is big.
Answers
  1. ti xamsi
  2. mi viska lo kevna
  3. lo xamsi cu barda

Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "I write using a pen." → mi ciska pi'o lo penbi
  2. "This is a cave." → ti kevna
  3. "I learn by reading." → mi cilre ta'i lo nu tcidu

Summary

You learned instrument and method tags: pi'o (using a tool), ta'i (by what method). These specify how actions are performed.
